name: A Complete Mixture Online Trivia | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which country is the Darling river?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	It is Australia's longest river.

questions.text: What was the name of George and Barbara Bush's dog?
questions.explanation:
Millie.

	Millie was the subject of a mock autobiography, as was Flush, who belonged to the poet Elizabeth Barrett Browning. Chequers and Buddy belonged to Presidents Nixon and Clinton.

questions.text: Which battle did Robert the Bruce win?
questions.explanation:
Bannockburn.

	Robert the Bruce, king of Scotland, defeated Edward II of England at Bannockburn.

questions.text: What is the English version of the Welsh place name, Ynys Mon?
questions.explanation:
Anglesey.

	Anglesey or Ynys Mon is an island just off the North Wales coast, across the Menai Straits.

questions.text: In what city is the classic British gangster film, 'Get Carter', set?
questions.explanation:
Newcastle-upon-Tyne.

	Michael Caine stars as Carter, who returns to Newcastle to bury his brother and revenge his death.

questions.text: In what field did Jonathan Cape and Hamish Hamilton become known?
questions.explanation:
Publishing.

	They both gave their names to publishing houses.

questions.text: Which actress played 'La Reine Margot' on film?
questions.explanation:
Isabelle Adjani.

	Isabelle Adjani starred in this 1994 historical drama.

questions.text: In London, what are St James, Clissold, Alexandra and Holland?
questions.explanation:
Parks.

	St James is a royal park opposite Buckingham Palace. Clissold Park is in Hackney, East {London;} Alexandra Park, which includes Alexandra Palace, is in north London. Holland Park is near Notting Hill in West London.

questions.text: Where was Joan of Arc executed?
questions.explanation:
Rouen.

	She was burnt at the stake in Rouen where there is now a church and a museum dedicatd to her.

Richard Bach.

	Richard Bach wrote 'Jonathan Livingston Seagull'. Richard Adams wrote 'Watership Down' featuring rabbits. Henry Williamson wrote 'Tarka the Otter' and Gavin Maxwell wrote 'Ring of bright water' also about otters.
